We have him, Watson, we have him,  and I dare swear that before to-morrow night he will be  fluttering in our net as helpless as one of his own butterflies.
Watson was asking for orders."
"I fear that Watson and I must go to London."
We will drive in to Coombe Tracey,  but Watson will leave his things as a pledge that he will come  back to you.
Watson, you will send a note to Stapleton to tell  him that you regret that you cannot come."
Now,  Watson, I think that we cannot employ our time better than by  calling upon your acquaintance, Mrs. Laura Lyons."
"My friend here, Dr.  Watson, has informed me of what you have communicated, and also  of what you have withheld in connection with that matter."
You have been inside the house, have you not, Watson?
"You say, Watson, that the lady is not there?"
"It's moving towards us, Watson."

I said it in London, Watson, and I say  it again now, that never yet have we helped to hunt down a more  dangerous man than he who is lying yonder"--he swept his long arm  towards the huge mottled expanse of green-splotched bog which  stretched away until it merged into the russet slopes of the  moor.
And now, my dear Watson, without referring to my notes,  I cannot give you a more detailed account of this curious case.
And now, my dear Watson, we have  had some weeks of severe work, and for one evening, I think, we  may turn our thoughts into more pleasant channels.
